messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Business is when people sell things or help others for money.  
Culture is how a group of people live and think.  
Many companies work with people in other countries.  
They often use English.  
But business talk can be very different in each country.  
If we do not know their ways, we can have problems.  
People can not understand each other.  
Here are three simple areas of business manners in different countries.  
They can help you.  
Next time you work with someone from another culture.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

Key terms such as nuances, expectations, unfair judgements, misunderstandings, and breakdowns in communication were replaced or omitted, causing significant loss of lexical detail. Suggestion: Reintroduce the concepts of "nuances" and "expectations" of business communication. Suggestion: Mention the risks of "unfair judgements," "misunderstandings," and "breakdowns in communication." Suggestion: Use precise language to preserve the original message’s meaning and detail.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Business is when people sell things or help others for money.  
Culture is how a group of people live and think.  
Many companies work with people in other countries.  
They often use English.  
Business talk has nuances (small different things).  
It has expectations (what people think is normal).  
If we do not know nuances and expectations, we make unfair judgements.  
This is when we say bad things about someone without knowing them.  
We can have misunderstandings (when people do not understand each other).  
We can have breakdowns in communication (when talk stops).  
Here are three things about business etiquette.  
Etiquette means rules for good talk.  
They are for different countries.  
Use them when you work with someone from another country.
Feedback received: Grade 2/10 - FAIL

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Business means when people sell things or help others for money.  
Culture means how a group of people live and think.  
Many business people work with people in other countries.  
Most of them use English to talk.  
But the small things that are different in business talk can change in each culture.  
What people think is normal can change too.  
If we do not understand these things, we say bad things about someone without knowing them.  
We can have misunderstandings.  
Talk can stop.  
Here are three simple rules for business talk in different cultures.  
Use them when you work with someone from another culture.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Business is when people sell things or help others for money.  
Culture is how a group of people live and think.  
Many business people work across international borders.  
They form a global business community.  
Most of them use English to talk.  
But cultural norms and business etiquette can differ in each culture.  
Cultural norms are the usual ways people behave.  
Business etiquette is polite rules for business talk.  
The nuances and expectations of business talk also change.  
Nuances are small differences.  
Expectations are what people think will happen.  
If we do not understand them, we make unfair ideas about people.  
We can have misunderstandings and stop talking.  
Here are three simple areas of business etiquette around the world.  
Use them when you work with someone from another culture.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8518 is below the required 0.90. This indicates significant loss of key terms and factual phrasing. For example, the original phrase 'A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgments, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication' was simplified to 'If we do not understand them, we make unfair ideas about people. We can have misunderstandings and stop talking,' losing critical terms such as 'judgments' and 'breakdowns in communication' and the cumulative effect of the list. Suggestion: Restore the original key terms and list structure (unfair judgments, misunderstandings, breakdowns in communication) to improve fidelity.

Culture means how a group of people live and think.
